research_topics.name: threshold_fine_tuning
research_topics.description: Fine-tune fallback thresholds around current best (0.35/0.45)
research_topics.hypothesis: Small threshold adjustments may find better accuracy/time tradeoff
research_topics.rationale: Baseline best config uses 0.35/0.45. Small variations may improve.

research_topics.name: lean_budget_optimization
research_topics.description: Reduce fevals to save time while maintaining accuracy
research_topics.hypothesis: Lower fevals with good init can match accuracy faster
research_topics.rationale: W3 finding: budget matters less than init. Try reducing fevals.

research_topics.name: onset_gradient_init
research_topics.description: Use temperature onset and gradient for smarter initialization
research_topics.rationale: Better init could reduce fevals needed for convergence

what_works: Fallback mechanism is critical for hard samples
what_doesnt_work: Too aggressive thresholds (0.34/0.44) cause excessive fallbacks and slow runtime
High fevals for 2-src (40) doesn't improve accuracy - just adds time
promising_directions: Smarter fallback triggering based on convergence patterns
